meanings.definition: A person who is habitually late.
meanings.sent1: Sarah is always the lateeners in our group, making us wait for her every time we meet.
meanings.sent2: The lateeners missed the bus again and had to find another way to get to work.
meanings.sent3: The lateeners showed up so late to the party that they missed the cake cutting!
meanings.sent4: Being a lateeners in life's journey can sometimes mean missing out on important opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The lateeners in the race finished last, but they were determined to improve their time next time.

meanings.definition: A device used for adjusting the tension of a sail on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailor adjusted the lateeners to catch the wind and move the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The lateeners on the sailboat helped control the direction of the boat in the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The lateeners on the sail were so tight that the ship glided smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent4: The lateeners on the sail acted like a skilled conductor, orchestrating the movement of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The lateeners on the sail were crucial in ensuring a safe and steady voyage across the ocean.

meanings.definition: A type of knot used in sailing to secure a line.
meanings.sent1: The sailor quickly tied a lateeners to secure the rope to the cleat on the dock.
meanings.sent2: Learning how to tie a lateeners properly is essential for any sailor setting out to sea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to untie the lateeners, causing the boat to drift away.
meanings.sent4: The lateeners held the rope firmly in place, preventing the sail from flapping in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The lateeners knot was so secure that even the strongest storm couldn't loosen it.
